Member Enumeration Documentation

◆ EulerType

enum rev::EulerAngles::EulerType

enum of all different possible rotation axis combinations

Note
Any extrinsic rotation is equivalent to an intrinsic rotation by the same angles but with inverted order of elemental rotations, and vice versa. For instance, the intrinsic rotations x-y'-z'' by angles a, b, c are equivalent to the extrinsic rotations z-y-x by angles c, b, a. Both are represented by a matrix R = X(a)Y(b)Z(c) for pre-multiplication

Member Data Documentation

◆ m_rotationSpace

RotationSpace rev::EulerAngles::m_rotationSpace
protected

Rotation space, either extrinsic or intrinsic.

Extrinsic rotations are performed with respect to an inertially fixed trio of axes, whereas intrinsic rotations are performed with respect to the rotated axes of a body
